intro: Cymbopetalum aequale, commonly known as the red-flowered cymbopetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Cymbopetalum aequale is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
